title: Accounting Clerk - Remote
description: company overview for more than 40 years williams adley has provided expert accounting auditing and consulting services to a growing number of federal state and local government agencies. our dedication to operating with the highest levels of honesty integrity and transparency means we frequently go beyond the typical vendorclient relationship becoming trusted advisors to our clients. direction of the accounting manager the accounting clerk will be responsible for the supporting accounting functions and serve as an entrylevel role involving fundamental accounting data entry tasks. as an accounting clerk you will be responsible for experience with or ability to manage and process expense reports. support with cash reconciliation tasks. ability to manage reminders for payroll and expense reports which will involve working a few hours every other weekend. support with the preparation and submission of 1099 reports. experience or ability to manage and maintain vendor profiles. accurately add and track hours for subcontractors and run labor batches. experience with or ability to perform accounts payable data entry tasks. add and manage indirect labor codes as needed. perform and assist with gl entries. support monthend closing activities. post payments to ar accounts. assist with mapping travel expenses to credit cards manage billing including items related to travel other duties as assigned by the accounting manager. required education and experience an associates degree in accounting or a related field is required. bachelors degree in progress is a plus. effective communication skills to address and resolve accounting issues between departments. attention to detail required and ability to troubleshoot issues by identifying and correcting errors in accounting batches. advanced knowledge of microsoft office suite and pdf and experience in jamis prime is preferred. must be able and willing to work long or outside of core hours with limited notice. supervision and guidance the accounting clerk will work under the supervision of the accounting manager and communicate with senior leaders partners and members of the organization at large. interview. once an offer has been accepted all applicants will be notified that the position has been filled. compensation benefits at williams adley we celebrate your contributions by providing you with opportunities and choices to support you and your familys total wellbeing. our health insurance offerings include comprehensive medical dental and vision plans and firmpaid basic lifead introduction to the job application and addressing knowledge skills and abilities. to qualify for this position applicants must document on the application that they possess all of the create effective and visually engaging materials. ability to troubleshoot software hardware and equipment issues and determine the most effective solutions. strong multitasking abilities with the briefing meetings creative reviews working sessions and creative status meetings. manage content updates intranet assets and job files for accessibility and organization. develop and maintain sops and support resourcing and prioritization. oversee and track the creative budget ensuring resources are allocated effectively. oversee longterm 412 month marketing and creative projects including ideation budgeting and execution. support marketing leadership in identifying the resources stakeholders and timelines associated with meeting key business objectives based on truewerks strategic plan. preferred including configuration of connected boards automations and workflows and custom reports and dashboards. strong proficiency in google workspace google suite. basic proficiency in adobe creative suite and figma. this is a hybrid role requiring some time in our office. candidates should be based near denver colorado and comfortable commuting to our office as needed. additional description: the access coach is a member of an integrated university success team providing individual academic and personal support to an assigned group of students as they progress through their time at suny plattsburgh. the successful candidate will help students with various topics and executive functioning skill building including academic progress course advisement financial literacy time management study skills and testtaking strategies. specific duties are expected to include but not be limited to providing counseling to selected participants regarding academic financial aid career and personal topics reviewing student progress and tracks student use of academic support services conducting regular outreach to faculty and other college staff to support student success maintaining accurate tracking data and notes for each assigned student organizing periodic special events and programs for students faculty and staff and working with other offices to provide advocacy and other services to assigned students. the accessibility resources office aro works with all students on campus who identify as having a disability providing equal access for students to have equitable opportunities during their time at college. we are part of the enrollment and student success division which supports a students entire collegiate experience from the point of admission through to graduation. we partner with students faculty and staff to provide a network of opportunities and services that lead to student success. collectively the division of enrollment and student success positively influences the health safety and wellbeing of the student body. as suny plattsburgh is an institution that delivers challenging and highquality educational experiences to a diverse group of learners the successful candidate must demonstrate an understanding of and sensitivity to diversity inclusion and equityminded policies programs and practices. show more show less
